Name: Ipconazole
Description: Ipconazole is a member of the class of cyclopentanols carrying 1,2,4-triazol-1-ylmethyl, 4-chlorobenzyl and isopropyl substituents at positions 1, 2 and 5 respectively. Used to control a range of seed diseases in rice, vegetables and other, mainly non-food, crops. It has a role as an EC 1.14.13.70 (sterol 14alpha-demethylase) inhibitor and an antifungal agrochemical. It is a member of cyclopentanols, a member of monochlorobenzenes, a member of triazoles, a tertiary alcohol, a conazole fungicide and a triazole fungicide.

plant_translocations.content: The metabolism of ipconazole, isopropyl-l-(1H-l,2,4-triazol-l-ylmethyl), after seed treatment was investigated in rice seedlings and mature plants. Seeds were treated with two types of 14C-labeled ipconazole, [T-14C]-ipconazole labeled at the triazole ring and [B-14C]-ipconazole labeled at the benzylmethylene position. After 22 days, 40-41% of the applied radioactivity was recovered from soil, 27% from roots and seeds, and only 0.36-0.42% from rice shoots. The main metabolites in rice seedlings were oxidative products at the carbons of the isopropyl group and the benzylmethylene, with trace amounts of conjugated metabolites. Residues in hulled rice from plants treated with [T-14C]-ipconazole and [B-14C]-ipconazole were 2.5 µg eq./kg and 0.2 csg eq./kg, respectively. Ipconazole and its metabolites detected in seedlings were not found in hulled rice, with most of the radioactivity from [T-14C]-ipconazole detected in the unextractable residue and water-soluble fraction from hulled rice.
plant_translocations.reference: 永塚隆由, 齋藤康毅, 千田常明, 佐竹慶吾, & 山口勇. (1994). Metabolism of ipconazole, a new triazole fungicide for seed treatment, in rice plants. Journal of Pesticide Science, 19(4), 285-297.

method.Plant Grown Condition: Seeds harvested in 1989, selected with salt solution before use. Details of plant growing conditions not provided.
method.Chemical Preparation: [T-14C]-ipconazole labeled on triazole ring (specific activity 1.88 GBq/mmol, 98.2/1.8 isomer ratio).[B-14C]-ipconazole labeled on benzyl position (specific activity 1.92 GBq/mmol, 94.4/5.6 isomer ratio). Radiolabeled compounds purified by column chromatography. Authentic standards of ipconazole and metabolites synthesized
method.Pesticide Application Details for the Pl: Seeds soaked in [T-14C]-ipconazole suspension (199 or 19 MBq/mmol) for 24h or 10 min respectively. Or seeds dressed by adding 199 MBq/mmol [T-14C]-ipconazole powder at 0.5% seed weight. Treated seeds soaked in water at 28°C for 3 days or kept unsoaked
method.Other Information: Radioactivity measured by liquid scintillation counting. Seeds washed with benzene to remove surface residues
